Hemolysis markers, liver enzymes, lipid profiles and blood sugar (Table 5)  In group A, there were significant differences in red blood cell, hemoglobin, hematocrit, L-asparate aminotransferase, alaninaminotransferase, lactate dehydrogenase, total bilirubin, indirect bilirubin, high density lipoprotein cholesterol and hemoglobin A1C (p b 0.05). The general prevalence of gallstones  Generally, gallstones are classified as cholesterol stones (80%), pigment stones (15%) including brown and black pigment stones (calcium bilirubinate stones) and miscellaneous.
